column4: Kifrî‎) is the central town of Kifri District in Diyala Governorate
column6: 70% of the population was Kurdish. The town is part of the Disputed areas of North Iraq and controlled by Kurdistan Region. A significant Iraqi Turkmen population is present as well.Eski Kifri (meaning ‘Old Kifri’ in the Iraqi Turkmen dialect) is a large and extensive site situated some eight kilometres south-west of Kifri.
